metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7466 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Ansible before version 2.3 has an input validation vulnerability in the handling of data sent from client systems. An attacker with control over a client system being managed by Ansible, and the ability to send facts back to the Ansible server, could use this flaw to execute arbitrary code on the Ansible server using the Ansible server privileges.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7466` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1.1
ansible-fireball - 2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1.1
ansible-node-fireball - 2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: msalvatore> This CVE identifies an incompete fix for CVE-2016-9587

criterions.comment: ansible package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.2-2ubuntu1.1').
